channel.title: CyberNetSec - Incident Response
channel.description: Latest incident response threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: INC Ransomware OPSEC Fail: Reused Infrastructure Leads to Data Recovery for 12 U.S. Victims
item.description:
A significant operational security (OPSEC) failure by the INC ransomware group has allowed cybersecurity firm Cyber Centaurs to recover stolen data for twelve U.S. organizations. The discovery was made after analyzing an attack involving the RainINC ransomware variant. Researchers found artifacts fr...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Incident Response, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Oregon DEQ Kept Data Breach of 4,800 People Secret for Nine Months
item.description:
The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) confirmed on January 13, 2026, that a cyberattack in April 2025 exposed the personal data of approximately 4,800 people. The agency opted not to issue a broad public disclosure, citing that Oregon law did not require it, and instead began sending ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: KIOTI Tractor Discloses Wider Impact from 2024 Data Breach
item.description:
Daedong-USA, Inc., parent company of the KIOTI® Tractor Division, issued a notice on January 2, 2026, expanding the scope of a data breach that originally occurred in October 2024. A prolonged investigation that concluded in late 2025 revealed that a wider range of highly sensitive personal informat...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Baker University Discloses Year-Old Breach Affecting Over 53,000 Individuals
item.description:
Baker University in Kansas has begun notifying 53,624 individuals about a severe data breach that occurred in December 2024. Attackers maintained access to the university's network for over two weeks, from December 2 to December 19, 2024. The compromised data is highly sensitive, including names, So...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: DoJ Dismantles $28M Bank Fraud Ring, Seizes Phishing Database
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Justice has seized the domain `web3adspanels.org` and its associated backend database, which were central to a massive bank account takeover fraud operation. The criminal scheme used phishing websites to impersonate financial institutions and harvest victim credentials, leadin...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Phishing, Incident Response

item.title: Major Blow to African Cybercrime: 574 Arrested, $3M Seized in International Takedown
item.description:
A large-scale, coordinated international law enforcement operation has dismantled several major cybercrime networks operating across West and Central Africa. The crackdown resulted in the arrest of 574 individuals and the seizure of approximately $3 million. The operation targeted criminal syndicate...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Incident Response, Phishing

item.title: Conduent Breach Exposes 10.5M Patients, Ranks as 8th Largest US Healthcare Breach
item.description:
Business services giant Conduent has disclosed a massive data breach that exposed the personal and medical information of over 10.5 million people, making it the 8th largest healthcare data breach in U.S. history. The breach, which was active for months between October 2024 and January 2025, has alr...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: TriZetto Discloses Year-Long Data Breach Exposing Patient PHI
item.description:
TriZetto Provider Solutions, a healthcare revenue management company owned by Cognizant, has started notifying clients about a major data breach. An unauthorized party had access to patient data for nearly a full year, from November 2024 until the breach was detected on October 2, 2025. The attacker...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Regulatory

item.title: G7 Unveils New Framework for Coordinated Cyber Response in Financial Sector
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group has published a new policy paper outlining non-binding principles for Collective Cyber Incident Response and Recovery (CCIRR) within the global financial sector. The framework, developed to foster greater cross-border cooperation, aims to improve information sharing, stream...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

item.title: Global Infrastructure Breach Alert Confirmed as False Alarm
item.description:
Initial reports on November 30, 2025, of a major security breach impacting global infrastructure were officially confirmed to be a false alarm. The panic was triggered when automated monitoring tools misinterpreted routine, benign system tests as a sophisticated cyberattack, leading to a cascade of ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Incident Response, Other
